name: invalidly
content:

in a way that is not legally or officially acceptable: Many of the certified signatures were invalidly collected. They claimed that the election had been held, but invalidly.
in a way that is not correct, usually because of not being logical or not based on correct information: These calculations invalidly compare a large country with many small ones. They decided that the plea was invalidly entered. See
invalid
